derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: from modern Latin amorphus, from Greek amorphos 'shapeless' (from a- 'without' + morphē 'form') + -ous

entry.tran: 无固定形状（或结构）的；不规则的；无组织的
entry.def: Something that is amorphous has no clear shape or structure.

example.ex: A dark, strangely amorphous shadow filled the room.
example.tran: 一团形状怪异的黑影笼罩了整个房间。

means.word_mean: 1. having no definite form or distinct shape;
2. lacking the system or structure characteristic of living bodies
3. without real or apparent crystalline form;

auth_sentence.content: The so-called amorphous forms of carbon...are actually composed of microcrystals.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The so-called amorphous forms of carbon...are actually composed of microcrystals.

means.word_mean: 乱七八糟的;难以归类的

sentences.en: I really cannot understand his amorphous ideas.
